page.title: 06SKREENS PARK,ROXWELL
page.content: The first mention of Skreens was in 1378. Skreens Mansion was built in 1445 and the owners were called Skreyne. They owned a lot of the land in Essex. John Skreyne died in 1471 26 years of owning Skreens. Richard Farmer was the owner of Skreens next in 1452 but he was attained for high treason and Skreens was given to HENRY VIII who gave it to Sir Richard Rich who sub leased it to Richard Sampford who had it for 3 years. Christopher Allen owned Skreens until 1554 when it was granted to Richard Weston. Skreens was passed down the family of Westons until it was sold to Sir John Bramston in 1635. Sir Bramston was born in 1577 at Maldon After being at school he went on to JESUS COLLEGE in Cambridge. He died at Skreens in the middle of the 17th century 1654.
